snippet: Speaker John A. Boehner seems to have decided that he may have more to lose by negotiating with the White House over spending cuts that begin Friday than by letting them happen.
abstract: Speaker John A Boehner stops negotiations to head off automatic budget cuts, instead digging in deeper and refusing to even discuss an increase in revenue; decision appears to please House Republicans, while causing frustration among Democrats and Obama administration; Boehner insists that it is time for the Senate to produce a measure aimed at the cuts.
lead_paragraph: Speaker John A. Boehner seems to have decided that he may have more to lose by negotiating with the White House over spending cuts that begin Friday than by letting them happen.

headline.seo: House Republicans Cheer Boehner’s Refusal to Negotiate on Cuts
headline.main: Boehner Halts Talks on Cuts, and House G.O.P. Cheers
headline.print_headline:
Boehner’s Halt
To Fiscal Talks
Cheers G.O.P.
